results.content: This course is very fast paced and direct to the point. It doesn't go into a lot of detail, but you can find tutorials on youtube and on Udemy to explain more in depth whatever you are missing. One thing this author didn't go over is AWS hosting prices in complete detail. He does say a little bit about pricing, but if you do go this route make sure you do a lot more research before you delve in and not be amazed at just how fast the server is. This course went so fast that it was finished within an hour. I thought that might be good, but in fact it left me wanting more information not covered in the course.

response.content: Thanks for the review, Eddie.  Its been on my mind to update this course since AWS changed the look of their gui since the making of this course.  It is true if you are going to use AWS to host a database, it will be kind of pricy.  However, small static sites are quite cheap.  Regardless,  these tips will help me make the next version even better and I do appreciate it!

Regardless, these tips will help me make the next version even better and I do appreciate it!

results.content: Simple instructions clearly demonstrated step-by-step. He speaks clearly and has a pleasant voice always nice when the teacher's voice aids learning instead of being a distraction. If your goal is a cheap, static website up and running fast this is the course to take. Well worth the $$.
